related_post.text: @Sairam In that case you can do this to check the emails (this is example REPL):```python>>> from email.utils import parseaddr(\'Full Name with quotes and <weird@chars.com>\ \'weird@example.com\')>>> parseaddr(\'foo@example.com\')(\'\ \'foo@example.com\')>>> parseaddr(\'Full Name <full@example.com>\')(\'Full Name\ \'full@example.com\')>>> parseaddr(\'"Full Name with quotes and <weird@chars.com> <weird@example.com>\')(\'Full Name with quotes and <weird@chars.com>\ \'weird@example.com\')```Taken from https://stackoverflow.com/a/14485817.

so_post.text: @Sairam In that case you can do this to check the emails (this is example REPL):```python>>> from email.utils import parseaddr(\'Full Name with quotes and <weird@chars.com>\ \'weird@example.com\')>>> parseaddr(\'foo@example.com\')(\'\ \'foo@example.com\')>>> parseaddr(\'Full Name <full@example.com>\')(\'Full Name\ \'full@example.com\')>>> parseaddr(\'"Full Name with quotes and <weird@chars.com> <weird@example.com>\')(\'Full Name with quotes and <weird@chars.com>\ \'weird@example.com\')```Taken from https://stackoverflow.com/a/14485817.
